Description: Ostracon, fragment (two pieces joined) of the body of a pale-red pottery wine-jar, the fabric is partially grey in section, the exterior is covered with a light-brown slip and remains of two lines of black-painted hieratic text.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amarna, el-, TA:26/323 North Suburb, South Central Quarter, The Slums, House U.37.14.
Curator's comments: Frankfort & Pendlebury, City of Akhenaten 2:16, pl.LVIII fig.13
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393482) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393482)
